info.description:
# Adobe Experience Cloud APIs

See more at [Adobe.IO](https://www.adobe.io/apis.html) or find me at [GilJimenez.com](https://giljimenez.com?cid=SM:GH:20200311:user_growth:postman:)
info.name: Adobe Experience Cloud

item.description:
Adobe Analytics APIS
See official docs at: https://adobedocs.github.io/analytics-2.0-apis/

request.description: Returns a list of users for the current user's login company
Retrieve All Segments
Get a Single Segment
Creates Segment
Update a Segment
Gets all available designs.

header.description: This API requires an API key for authorization and bearer token for authentication. The API Key is obtained when creating an integration in the Adobe I/O Console. Refer *[How to set up Adobe IO Authentication - Step by Step](https://helpx.adobe.com/marketing-cloud-core/kb/adobe-io-authentication-step-by-step.html)* for information on creating the integration.

query.description: Number of resources to skip from start in the server list. If not specified, the response list will start from first available resource.
Number of resources to request. If not specified, the response will include all available resources.
Whether to include the design content.

response.name: Successful request with list of design resources in response

request.description: Gets the design with the given ID.

response.name: Successful request with design resource in response

response.name: Successful request with deleted design resource in response

request.description:
Validates a design by verifying the correctness of the script. If its correct, it returns number of entity objects used
in the script; otherwise it returns the validation error.

_Note this POST request does not create any resource. The endpoint is not a resource but rather it is simply a method to
validate the design in request payload._.

header.description: This API requires an API key for authorization and bearer token for authentication. The API Key is obtained when creating an integration in the Adobe I/O Console. Refer *[How to set up Adobe IO Authentication - Step by Step](https://helpx.adobe.com/marketing-cloud-core/kb/adobe-io-authentication-step-by-step.html)* for information on creating the integration.

response.name: Design resource validated with validation result in response

request.description: Updates the design with new name and/or new script as specified and returns the updated design definition.

query.description: Whether to include the design content.

response.name: Successful request with updated design resource in response

request.description:
Deletes entities referenced by the given IDs. **If no ID is given, all entities in the given environment are deleted.
If no environment ID is given, entities will be deleted from all environments. Use this with caution!**

_Note this DELETE request does not delete a singular resource. The endpoint is not a resource but rather it is simply a
method to delete multiple entities specified in request payload._

header.description: This API requires an API key for authorization and bearer token for authentication. The API Key is obtained when creating an integration in the Adobe I/O Console. Refer *[How to set up Adobe IO Authentication - Step by Step](https://helpx.adobe.com/marketing-cloud-core/kb/adobe-io-authentication-step-by-step.html)* for information on creating the integration.

query.description: List of entity IDs. If not set, all entities will be deleted.
ID of an environment. If not set, entities will be deleted from all environments.

response.name: Successful request with entity batch delete result in response

request.description:
Creates entities, updates if present, with the given entity details and returns the numbers of entities rejected, and
created or updated. Entities can be rejected if entity details do not conform to the schema.
[More info](https://docs.adobe.com/content/help/en/target/using/recommendations/entities/entity-attributes.html).

_Note this POST request does not create a singular resource. The endpoint is not a resource but rather it is simply a
method to save multiple entities specified in request payload._

request.description: Gets entity with the given ID from default environment. To retrieve entity from a specific environment, `environmentId` request parameter can be used.

body.raw:
{
    "aggregation": "NONE",
    "backupDisabled": false,
    "backupInclusionFilteringEnabled": true,
    "configuration": {
        "datasource": "mboxes"
    },
    "daysCount": "TWO_DAYS",
    "excludePurchases": true,
    "minInventory": 2,
    "name": "Garage Top Viewed",
    "partialDesignAllowed": true,
    "type": "VIEWED"
}

body.raw:
{
    "aggregation": "NONE",
    "backupDisabled": false,
    "backupInclusionFilteringEnabled": true,
    "configuration": {
        "pastBehaviorOrdinal": 0
    },
    "criteriaGroup": "CATEGORY",
    "daysCount": "TWO_WEEKS",
    "excludePurchases": true,
    "key": "FAVORITE",
    "name": "Most Popular Content from Visitor's Favorite Category",
    "partialDesignAllowed": false,
    "type": "VIEWED"
}

header.description: This API requires an API key for authorization and bearer token for authentication. The API Key is obtained when creating an integration in the Adobe I/O Console. Refer *[How to set up Adobe IO Authentication - Step by Step](https://helpx.adobe.com/marketing-cloud-core/kb/adobe-io-authentication-step-by-step.html)* for information on creating the integration.

request.description: Retrieve details of all jobs for the current logged-in user.

Retrieves the details of a single user within a specified organization, identified by email address or username and domain. Successful queries return a 200 response whose body is a single JSON structure containing the user information.

item.name: Get Users in a User Group or Product Profile

request.description: Gets a paged list of users in a specific group of an organization along with information about them. Groups can be named user groups, product profiles, or group-specific administrative groups.

Retrieve a paged list of all users in your organization along with information about them. The number of users returned in each call is subject to change but never exceeds 200 entries. You can make multiple paginated calls to retrieve the full list of users. The domain query parameter filters the results to only return users within a specified domain.

item.name: Get User Groups and Product Profiles

request.description: Retrieves a paged list of all user groups and product profiles in your organization along with information about them. You can make multiple paginated calls to retrieve the full list.
Adds a user who has an existing Adobe ID.
